intro: Aporosa sorsogonensis, commonly known as the Sorsogon Island aporosa, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
